FuncDef:
The task-group command adds a task group to the list of task groups that are associated with a user group.
The undo task-group command deletes a task group from a task group list.
By default, the task group is not in the task group list associated with the user group.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the name of a task group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters containing letters, digits, and underscores (_). The value can not contain the following characters or symbols: \, /, :, *, | , ?, ", <, >

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The task-group command is used to configure the list of task groups that are associated with a user group and then set rights granted to this user group.
Configuration Impact
The task-group command modifies the rights of users in this user group.
Precautions
One user group can be used by multiple local users. However, a local user belongs to only one user group.
After a task group is added to a task group list that is associated with the user group, this task group cannot be deleted.
The right of a user group is a set of rights specified in task groups that are associated with this user group.
